title: Linux last Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux last command, which displays information about the last users who have logged into the system. Learn how to use it effectively with practical examples.

meta.title: Linux last Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux last command, which displays information about the last users who have logged into the system. Learn how to use it effectively with practical examples.
meta.keywords: Linux, last command, user management, login history, system administration

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of the last Command

verify.name: Verify the last command output
verify.hint: The `last` command output should contain entries for the user `labex`.

verify.name: Verify the last command output with options
verify.hint: The `last` command output should contain the expected information when using the `-n 3`, `-x`, and `-i` options.

verify.name: Verify the last command output for specific user
verify.hint: The `last labex` command output should contain entries for the user `labex`.

verify.name: Verify the last command output for specific user and terminal
verify.hint: The `last labex pts/0` command output should contain entries for the user `labex` on the `pts/0` terminal.
